original: Holmberg, Bengt Olaus, fil. dr, lektor, Skövde, f. 30/11/04 i Gbg av musikdir. Oilof H. o. Esther Lundén. G. 33 m. Kerstin Mannerskantz. Barn: Bengt-Olof f. 34, Björn 39, Elisabeth 41. — Stud:ex. 24, fil. mag. 30, fil. lic. 37, fil. dr 47. Res. t. Tyskl. 26, 37, Island 30, Frankr., Ital., Spän., Nord-afr. 33. Lär. v. Sigtunask. 31-32, e. lär. o. e. o. adj. v. Upps. h. a. 1. 33-40, adj. där 40-47, lektor i modersm. o. tyska v. h. a. il. i Skövde fr. 47. Und. Upps:tid. timlar. v. h. elem:lärov. o. gymn. f. fl. samt v. försv. lärov. Skr.: Fr. Strindberg t. Harry Martinson (tills. m. adj. M. Persson 45); Tomt o. toft s. appellativ o. ortnamnselement (ak. avh. 46), div. art. i dags-o. fackpress.
translated: Holmberg, Bengt Olaus, PhD, lecturer, born on 30/11/04 in Gothenburg to the music director Oilof H. and Esther Lundén. Married in 1933 to Kerstin Mannerskantz. They have three children: Bengt-Olof born in 1934, Björn born in 1939, and Elisabeth born in 1941. Holmberg obtained his high school diploma in 1924, Bachelor of Arts degree in 1930, Licentiate of Philosophy degree in 1937, and Doctor of Philosophy degree in 1947. He resided in Germany in 1926 and 1937, Iceland in 1930, France, Italy, Spain, and North Africa in 1933. He taught at Sigtunaskolan in 1931-32, was an assistant teacher and lecturer at Uppsala University from 1933-40, an assistant teacher at Uppsala high school from 1940-47, and a lecturer in Swedish and German at a high school in Skövde from 1947. He taught Swedish language and literature and gymnasium courses while at Uppsala, and military schools. He wrote: "Fr. Strindberg t. Harry Martinson" (together with assistant teacher M. Persson in 1945); "Tomt o. toft s. appellativ o. ortnamnselement" (academic dissertation in 1946), and several articles in daily and professional press.

publication.name: Tomt o. toft s. appellativ o. ortnamnselement
